intro: Ceropegia lodarensis var. rubrosticta, commonly known as the red-streaked African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly waxy texture. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of growing conditions. It is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Asclepiadaceae family.
